A multifunctional quasi-solid-state polymer electrolyte with highly selective ion highways for practical zinc ion batteries
item.description: The dendrite growth and parasitic reactions on Zn anodes pose significant challenges for the application of aqueous zinc-ion batteries. Here, the authors report a versatile quasi solid-state polymer electrolyte engineered with abundant ion transport channels for enhanced zinc ion battery performance.

item.title: Atomically distributed Al-F3 nanoparticles towards precisely modulating pore size of carbon membranes for gas separation
item.description: Carbon molecular sieve (CMS) membranes efficiently separate gas mixtures tuning the pore size of CMS membranes remains challenging. Here, the authors report an approach to finely modulate CMS pore structure via reactive Al(CH3)3 to atomic-level Al2O3 and defluorinated the polymer precursor in situ to Al-F3 particles during pyrolysis.

item.title: Influence of phonon anharmonicity on Raman spectra of Cu2ZnSn(S,Se)4 polycrystalline thin films through computational study
Effect of stearic acid and sodium stearate on hydrophobicity of nano calcium carbonate and mechanism of water vapor adsorption
Compressible, anti-fatigue, extreme environment adaptable, and biocompatible supramolecular organohydrogel enabled by lignosulfonate triggered noncovalent network
item.description: Development of synthetic load bearing materials is important, but it can be challenging to achieve all the required properties. Here, the authors report the development of an organohydrogel from biobased materials, with favourable compressive strength and toughness.

item.title: Coordinatively stiffen and toughen polymeric gels via the synergy of crystal-domain cross-linking and chelation cross-linking
item.description: Polymer gels have potential in both flexible electronics and impact protections materials, but the balance between stiffness and toughness can be hard to achieve. Here, the authors report a gel with high-density crystalline domains linked by soft chelation crosslinking domains.

item.title: Enhanced non-classical electrostriction in strained tetragonal ceria
item.description: Non-classical electrostriction in fluorites arises from defect-induced polarization and lattice distortions. This study shows that mismatch strain in Gd-doped CeO2 thin films fine-tunes electromechanical responses, achieving high electrostriction above 10−15 m2V−2.

item.title: Experimental research on remote non-contact laser vibration measurement for tunnel lining cavities
Upconverting microgauges reveal intraluminal force dynamics in vivo
item.description: Nanoparticle-based ‘microgauges’ are developed for in vivo force sensing and deployed in C. elegans to investigate how mechanical force correlates with electrical signalling in neuromuscular organs.

item.title: Mycosynthesis of zinc sulfide/zinc oxide nanocomposite using Fusarium oxysporum for catalytic degradation of methylene blue dye, antimicrobial, and anticancer activities
Characterisation of the optical response to seismic waves of submarine telecommunications cables with distributed and integrated fibre-optic sensing
Strained two-dimensional tungsten diselenide for mechanically tunable exciton transport
item.description: Here, the authors transfer monolayer WSe2 onto a pre-stretched substrate to achieve a sinusoidal ripple pattern that leads to alternating compressive/tensile strains. They study quantitatively how efficiently strain can induce exciton funneling and what parameters are important.

item.title: The assessment of sports performance by grip pressure using flexible piezoresistive pressure sensors in seven sports events
High-performance 2D electronic devices enabled by strong and tough two-dimensional polymer with ultra-low dielectric constant
item.description: Low-dielectric-constant (k < 2) materials are needed to reduce crosstalk, delay and power consumption in microelectronic circuits. Here, the authors report the growth of low-k 2D fluoride-rich polymer thin films, showing good mechanical properties and their application for the realization of 2D MoS2 transistors with improved performance.

item.title: In situ visualization of interfacial processes at nanoscale in non-alkaline Zn-air batteries
item.description: Zinc-air batteries typically employ alkaline electrolytes and the fundamental understanding of their operation with non-alkaline electrolytes is less explored. Here, authors use in situ atomic force microscopy to elucidate the interfacial reactions at both electrodes in non-alkaline electrolytes.

item.title: Silver-coated PMMA nanoparticles-on-a-mirror substrates as high-performance SERS sensors for detecting infinitesimal molecules
Toward mechanistic understanding of wettability alteration in carbonate rocks in the presence of nanoparticles, gelatin biopolymer, and core-shell nanocomposite of Fe3O4@gelatin
Trinitroglycerine-loaded chitosan nanoparticles attenuate renal ischemia-reperfusion injury by modulating oxidative stress
Study on jet dynamic impact performance under the influence of standoff
Displacement and stress response of open-web girders under near field explosive loading
Experimental study on ultrasonic reduction of irreducible water saturation in low permeability reservoir
Dual-fluorescent starch biopolymer films containing 5-(4-nitrophenyl)-1,3,4-thiadiazol-2-amine powder as a functional nanofiller
Catalytic conversion of biomass-derived 5-hydroxymethylfurfural to 5-hydroxymethyl-2-furancarboxylic acid using novel cobalt-based MOF in the presence of deep eutectic solvents
Preparation and electromagnetic waves absorption performance of novel peanut shell/CoFe2O4/(RGO)x/PVA nanocomposites
Spectroscopic approach to optimize the biogenic silver nanoparticles for photocatalytic removal of ternary dye mixture and ecotoxicological impact of treated wastewater
Amelioration of cognition by hesperidin-conjugated cobalt oxide nanoparticles
Nonporous TiO2@C microsphere with a highly integrated structure for high volumetric lithium storage and enhance initial coulombic efficiency
Application of FCEEMD-TSMFDE and adaptive CatBoost in fault diagnosis of complex variable condition bearings
Algae-mediated copper nanocatalyst for aerobic oxidation and dye decolourization via sustainable wastewater treatment
Compositional engineering of phase-stable and highly efficient deep-red emitting phosphor for advanced plant lighting systems
item.description: We synthesized pure olivine phase Na1.06MgP0.94Si0.06O4:Eu deep-red phosphor using straightforward compositional engineering. This phosphor attains a remarkable EQE value of 52%, surpassing the previous record for oxide-based deep-red phosphors, while maintaining a high thermal stability of 85.4% at 150 °C.

item.title: JWST sighting of decametre main-belt asteroids and view on meteorite sources
item.description: Combining the infrared capabilities of JWST and synthetic tracking techniques, the detection of some of the smallest asteroids ever observed in the main belt is reported; their large abundance reveals a population driven by collisional cascade.

item.title: Electrically induced insulator-to-metal transition in InP-based ion-gated transistor
Fluorescence imaging of individual ions and molecules in pressurized noble gases for barium tagging in 136Xe
item.description: Barium tagging is a key ingredient for future detectors of neutrinoless double beta decay in low-background environments. Here, the authors demonstrate fluorescence imaging of single Ba2+ ions in high pressure Xenon gas, by comparing activity between Ba2+ chelated and unchelated samples of crown-ether chemosensors.

item.title: Methodological optimization for efficient degradation of Acid Violet 49 using advanced oxidation processes and varied photocatalyst combinations
Hydrophobicity of periodic structure with taper angle under pressure impact
Oxidative stress-induced cytotoxicity of HCC2998 colon carcinoma cells by ZnO nanoparticles synthesized from Calophyllum teysmannii
Free vibration of nanobeams with surface and dynamic flexoelectric effects
Frequency analysis of tetra layered FGM cylindrical shell with S-S Edge condition
Remotely extinguishing flames through transient acoustic streaming using time reversal focusing of sound
Probing electronic-structure pH-dependency of Au nanoparticles through X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy
An innovative cellular medicine approach via the utilization of novel nanotechnology-based biomechatronic platforms as a label-free biomarker for early melanoma diagnosis
Study of repulsive permanent magnetic levitation mechanism and its dynamic characteristics
City bus seat vibration analysis using 6-axis accelerometer and gyroscope sensors
Magnetic and pH sensitive nanocomposite microspheres for controlled temozolomide delivery in glioblastoma cells
Synergistic growth suppression of Fusarium oxysporum MLY127 through Dimethachlon Nanoencapsulation and co-application with Bacillus velezensis MLY71
Dynamic anti-correlations of water hydrogen bonds
item.description: The strength of water’s hydrogen bonds is not just statistically distributed. Using ultrafast spectroscopy of isotopically dilute water the authors show that each water molecules preferentially donates one short and one long hydrogen bond.

item.title: Phonon dispersion of buckled two-dimensional GaN
item.description: The authors investigate phonon behaviors of buckled two-dimensional GaN, determining the phonon dispersion of buckled two-dimensional GaN, revealing a larger phonon band gap compared to bulk GaN.

item.title: Influence of the driving environment on the dynamic characteristics of a DCT vehicle starting considering the longitudinal and vertical coupling model
Development of green synthesised AgNPs decorated on MWCNT modified guar gum-based self-healing hydrogel for strain sensors
ABAQUS-based research on the parameters of highway subgrade vibratory compaction and vibration wave propagation laws
Strain induced crystal lattice softening and improved thermoelectric performance of hydrogenated silicene for energy harvesting applications
Measuring competing outcomes of a single-molecule reaction reveals classical Arrhenius chemical kinetics
item.description: Controlling matter one molecule at a time is the ultimate goal of nanotechnology. Here, the authors show that it is possible to use a scanning tunnelling microscope to measure and influence the outcome of a single-molecule reaction with multiple competing outcomes.

item.title: Phenolic multiple kinetics-dynamics and discrete crystallization thermodynamics in amorphous carbon nanostructures for electromagnetic wave absorption
item.description: This study presents a phenolic synthesis platform with high spatial dimensional diversity, to elucidate the origin of the dielectric properties in amorphous carbon and the cascade effect during electromagnetic wave absorption.

item.title: Research on intelligent semi-active control algorithms and seismic reliability based on machine learning
Elastic and magnetic characteristics of nano-spinel ferrite Co0.5 MgxCu0.5−xFe2O4
EGFR-targeting polydopamine nanoparticles co-loaded with 5-fluorouracil, irinotecan, and leucovorin to potentially enhance metastatic colorectal cancer therapy
Green synthesis of Brassica carinata microgreen silver nanoparticles, characterization, safety assessment, and antimicrobial activities
Uniform blue emitting carbon nanodots synthesized from fig fruit using reverse diffusion purification
Life cycle assessment (LCA) of circular consumer electronics based on IC recycling and emerging PCB assembly materials
Modal analysis of PE pipeline under seabed dynamic pressure
Multimodal separation and cross fusion network based on Raman spectroscopy and FTIR spectroscopy for diagnosis of thyroid malignant tumor metastasis
Eco-friendly fabrication of copper oxide nanoparticles using peel extract of Citrus aurantium for the efficient degradation of methylene blue dye
Mechanochemical activation of 2D MnPS3 for sub-attomolar sensing
item.description: Here, the authors develop a plasmon-free SERS platform based on two-dimensional MnPS3 with sub-attomolar detection limit. Their strategy is based on a mechanochemical approach that combines wrinkling and chemical functionalization to boost SERS performance, making it relevant for biosensing.

item.title: Fluorescent antimicrobial hydrogel based on fluorophore N-doped carbon dots originated from cellulose nanocrystals
Panax ginseng nanoemulsion for counteracting male infertility via modulating sex hormones and oxidative stress in a rat model
PlQC based highly sensitive and reproducible novel SERS active substrate for biomolecule detection with high specificity
Heteroatom-doped magneto-fluorescent carbon dots, a potent agent for multimodal imaging
Synthesis, characterization, and adsorption performance of naphthalene-based covalent organic polymer for high-efficiency methylene blue removal
Synthesis and characterization of fluorenone derivatives with electrical properties explored using density functional theory (DFT)
Integrable utilization of intermittent sunlight and residual heat for on-demand CO2 conversion with water
item.description: Residual industrial heat could be harnessed as an energy source for CO2 conversion. Here the authors present a method for storing electrons and hydrogen in catalysts using light and water, which are then released upon heating to enable CO2 reduction with intermittent sunlight and residual heat.

item.title: Innovative engineering of scalable, renewable and spherical organic nanoparticles for high fire safety, UV protection and antibacterial properties of polyvinyl alcohol nanocomposites films
Green synthesized CaO decorated ternary CaO/g-C3N4/PVA nanocomposite modified glassy carbon electrode for enhanced electrochemical detection of caffeic acid
Coordination engineering of heterogeneous high-valent Fe(IV)-oxo for safe removal of pollutants via powerful Fenton-like reactions
item.description: Coordination engineering of high-valent Fe(IV)-oxo may break the activity-selectivity trade-off of traditional reactive oxygen species but the controllable generation of heterogeneous FeIV=O remains unexplored. Here, the authors alter the coordination number of Fe-Nx single-atom catalysts to regulate oxidation behaviors of heterogeneous FeIV=O.

item.title: Enhanced photocatalytic activity of ZnS/TiO2 nanocomposite by nitrogen and tetrafluoromethane plasma treatments
Complex charge density waves in simple electronic systems of two-dimensional III2–VI3 materials
item.description: This study introduces a family of multiple charge-density-wave orders in 2D III2–VI3 materials, including the chiral Star-of-David configuration. The charge-density-wave transitions involve both metal-to-insulator and insulator-to-insulator transitions, providing a platform for understanding the origins of charge density waves.

item.title: Research progress on aero-optical effects of hypersonic optical window with film cooling
item.description: In response to the challenges of obscuring phenomenon faced by high-speed aircraft, this article focuses on the mechanism, testing, and suppression technology research progress of hypersonic aero-optical effects.

item.title: Effect of carbon nanotubes and zinc oxide on electrical and mechanical properties of polyvinyl alcohol matrix composite by electrospinning method
Magnetic hydrogel scaffold based on hyaluronic acid/chitosan and gelatin natural polymers
Specific heat analyses on optical-phonon-derived uniaxial negative thermal expansion system TrZr2 (Tr = Fe and Co1− xNix)
Isotope-dependent site occupation of hydrogen in epitaxial titanium hydride nanofilms
item.description: The lattice location of hydrogen in titanium hydride nanofilms was identified by the channeling 15N-NRA mapping. H and D occupy the tetrahedral and octahedral sites differently because of the hydrogen Jahn-Teller effect and nuclear quantum effect.

item.title: Characterization of Schiff base self-healing hydrogels by dynamic speckle pattern analysis
Size dependent properties of Gd3+-free versus Gd3+-doped carbon dots for bioimaging application
Novel antimicrobial biodegradable composite films as packaging materials based on shellac/chitosan, and ZnAl2O4 or CuAl2O4 spinel nanoparticles
Green synthesis of fluorescent N-doped carbon quantum dots from castor seeds and their applications in cell imaging and pH sensing
A green approach to improve antibacterial properties of PVC/PVDF film doped by silver nanoparticles via nanosecond laser ablation for wound healing application
Light patterning semiconductor nanoparticles by modulating surface charges
item.description: The integration of colloidal nanoparticles into microdevices is essential for several advanced technologies. Here, the authors have developed a scalable method of UV-triggered surface charge modulation for the rapid surface patterning with semiconductor nanoparticles.

item.title: Molecular modeling analyses of functionalized cellulose
Low dielectric properties of alkali-free aluminoborosilicate fiber glasses for PCB applications at 10 GHz
Hydrogel-embedded vertically aligned metal-organic framework nanosheet membrane for efficient water harvesting
item.description: Metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) have shown promising potential in water harvesting, but the water uptake of single-component MOFs remains limited. Here, authors fabricate vertically aligned MOF nanosheets on hydrogel membranes to achieve ultrafast water harvesting with high water uptake.

item.title: Nanocarrier mediated delivery of insecticides into tarsi enhances stink bug mortality
item.description: Current insecticide delivery practices are inefficient, with only a fraction reaching the intended target. This study developed carbon dot nanocarriers with molecular baskets to enhance the delivery of insecticides through stink bug tarsal pores, significantly increasing insecticide efficacy.

item.title: Analytical solution of time-fractional Emden-Fowler equations arising in astronomy and mathematical physics
Gamma-ray shielding effectiveness, optical, mechanical, dielectric properties of nanofiller-reinforced PVA/PVP polymeric blend nanocomposites
Individually addressed entangling gates in a two-dimensional ion crystal
item.description: Quantum gates in 2D ion crystals are more challenging than in 1D. Here, the authors use their 2D ion trap platform and acousto-optical deflectors to demonstrate a 2-qubit gate that can stand the ion micromotion in such configuration.

item.title: Microwave assisted synthesis of ErxYbyCa1-x-yMoO4 nano-phosphor for efficient temperature sensing and catalytic applications
Effect of ZnO/EAF slag doping on removal of methyl red dye (MR) from industrial waste water
Biogenic silver nanoparticles incorporated hydrogel beads for anticancer and antibacterial activities
mRNA delivery enabled by metal–organic nanoparticles
item.description: Potential toxicity from cationic moieties and limited organ tropism are two challenges faced by current mRNA delivery vehicles. Here, authors develop non-cationic, highly biocompatible metal–organic nanoparticles that enable robust mRNA expression in vivo with tunable organ tropism.

item.title: Cavity-assisted resonance fluorescence from a nitrogen-vacancy center in diamond
Investigating antibacterial activity of biosynthesized silver oxide nanoparticles using Phragmanthera Macrosolen L. leaf extract
Experimental and theoretical insights into the adsorption mechanism of methylene blue on the (002) WO3 surface
Studying the properties of green synthesized silver oxide nanoparticles in the application of organic dye degradation under visible light
Pathway-directed recyclable chirality inversion of coordinated supramolecular polymers
item.description: Elucidation of the fundamental mechanisms behind the dynamic chirality inversion of supramolecular assemblies with pathway complexity is challenging. Here, the authors report metal coordination driven assembly systems based on pyridyl-conjugated cholesterol and show that metal ions facilitate pathway-directed, recyclable chirality inversion and assembly polymorphism.

item.title: Interface analysis of oxide free MoS2 films fabricated by solution process
On the nature of hydrogen bonding in the H2S dimer
item.description: Hydrogen bonding is a central concept in (bio)chemistry and has been intensively studied in the prototypical complex H2O-H2O. In this joint experimental/theoretical study, the authors find hydrogen bonding in H2S-H2S to be distinctly different.

item.title: Breaking dielectric dilemma via polymer functionalized perovskite piezocomposite with large current density output
item.description: By functionalizing polystyrene with perovskite FAPbBr2I, both the dielectric constant and dielectric strength are controlled, leading to energy-dense composite films for piezoelectric nanogenerators with normalized current density of 25 µA.cm−2 N−1

item.title: Rapid synthesis of cobalt manganese phosphate by microwave-assisted hydrothermal method and application as positrode material in supercapatteries
Computational identification of PDL1 inhibitors and their cytotoxic effects with silver and gold nanoparticles
A thermodynamic based constitutive model considering the mutual influence of multiple physical fields
Development of a sustainable and disposable modified Bi-CdFe2O4 electrode for electrochemical sensing of lead (II) and Acetaminophen drug molecule
Self-assembled sub-picoliter liquid periodic structures in a hollow optical fiber
DFT simulations of the elastic, optoelectronic, and thermoelectric attributes of AOsCl3 (A = K, Rb), a robust and environmentally friendly perovskites for green energy implications
Phonon modes and electron–phonon coupling at the FeSe/SrTiO3 interface
item.description: Phonons at the FeSe/STO interface are imaged at atomic scale, uncovering new optical phonon modes that couple strongly with electrons, shedding light on the microscopic origin of the interfacial EPC and providing insights into achieving superconducting transition temperature enhancement.

item.title: Ligand modulated charge transfers in Z-scheme configured Ni-MOF/g-C3N4 nanocomposites for photocatalytic remediation of dye-polluted water
Enhancing shielding efficiency of ordinary and barite concrete in radiation shielding utilizations
Simultaneous path weak-measurements in neutron interferometry
Au-H2Ti3O7 nanotubes for non-invasive anticancer treatment by simultaneous photothermal and photodynamic therapy
The inhibition mechanism of ultrasonic vibration on stick-slip phenomenon of sliding friction pair
Unravelling the effect of crystal lattice compression on the supercapacitive performance of hydrothermally grown nanostructured hollandite α-MnO2 induced by incremental growth time
Preparation and characterization of a new Gd2O3-epoxy composite for neutron shielding applications
High-resolution laser spectroscopy of singly charged natural uranium isotopes
Bidirectional enhancement of output performance of nanogenerators by M-COFs materials
Exploring nanoparticle dynamics in binary chemical reactions within magnetized porous media: a computational analysis
Dynamic hybrid parallel computing of the Ray Model for solving underwater acoustic fields in vast sea
Anisotropic piezoresistive response of 3D-printed pressure sensor based on ABS/MWCNT nanocomposite
Micromechanism of interparticle normal magnetic attraction effect in magnetorheological suspensions based on magnetic-dipole theory
Integrating an antimicrobial nanocomposite to bioactive electrospun fibers for improved wound dressing materials
Antibacterial activity of green synthesized copper oxide nanoparticles against multidrug-resistant bacteria
A study on aerodynamic pass-by noise based on equivalent source method
Determination of platinum-resistance of women with ovarian cancer by FTIR spectroscopy combined with multivariate analyses and machine learning methods
Light-modulated van der Waals force microscopy
item.description: A near-field microscopy, named light-modulated van der Waals force microscopy, is reported to discriminate compositions of materials with sub-10 nm spatial resolution by probing a dynamic van der Waals force between tip and sample.

item.title: Solvent mediated synthesis of multicolor narrow bandwidth emissive carbon quantum dots and their potential in white light emitting diodes
Significant role of secondary electrons in the formation of a multi-body chemical species spur produced by water radiolysis
Near-petahertz fieldoscopy of liquid
item.description: Near-petahertz electric field detection of few-femtosecond pulses with a temporal resolution of 200 attoseconds and subfemtojoule sensitivity is experimentally demonstrated, paving the path towards high-resolution biological spectro-microscopy.

item.title: Silver nanoparticles synthesized using aerial part of Achillea fragrantissima and evaluation of their bioactivities
Investigating compatibilization of polyoxymethylene/styrene-butadiene-styrene immiscible blend through addition of hydroxylated graphene
Atomic-scale visualization of defect-induced localized vibrations in GaN
item.description: Authors identify three types of defect-derived phonon modes in GaN, including localized defect modes, a confined bulk mode, and a fully extended mode. The defects exhibit a smaller phonon energy gap and lower sound speeds, indicating reduced thermal conductivity.

item.title: A cluster-nanozyme-coenzyme system mimicking natural photosynthesis for CO2 reduction under intermittent light irradiation
item.description: Natural photosynthesis converts H2O and CO2 into carbohydrates through all-weather reactions based on enzymes and coenzymes. Here, the authors report an artificial photosynthesis system under intermittent light irradiation by integrating nanozyme complexes and ubiquinone on a copper nanocluster.

item.title: Ultrahigh thermal stability and piezoelectricity of lead-free KNN-based texture piezoceramics
item.description: The authors induce a phase boundary similar to Pb(Zr, Ti)O3’s morphotropic phase boundary structure in (K, Na)NbO3-based ceramics, which exhibit high residual polarization as well as a significantly improved piezoelectric constant d33.

item.title: A multi-function glass shield for neutrons and gamma rays of boron- and bismuth-reinforced silicate glass
Image-guided computational holographic wavefront shaping
item.description: Guide-star-free imaging through turbid media is achieved by computational back-projection and averaging of as few as 25 holographically measured scattered fields under a random unknown illumination.

item.title: 4.8-μm CO-filled hollow-core silica fiber light source
Signature of the Kondo effect in superparamagnetic GO incorporated Cobalt substituted Ni/NiO nanoparticles
Synergistic wall digestion and cuproptosis against fungal infections using lywallzyme-induced self-assembly of metal-phenolic nanoflowers
item.description: Fungal infections can be debilitating and life-threatening. Here, the authors report a fungicidal strategy by the combination of cell wall digestion and cuproptosis using lywallzyme-assembled copper-phenolic nanoflowers demonstrating synergistic effects in fungal infection and fungal keratitis models.

item.title: Nano-enhanced storage of American cotton using metal-oxide nanoparticles for improving seed quality traits
Visualising the strength development of FICP-treated sand using impedance spectroscopy
Biofabrication of highly effective and easily regenerated CuO nanoparticles as adsorbents for Congo red and malachite green removal
PLA based biodegradable bionanocomposite filaments reinforced with nanocellulose: development and analysis of properties
Preparation of biocompatible Zein/Gelatin/Chitosan/PVA based nanofibers loaded with vitamin E-TPGS via dual-opposite electrospinning method
ZnFe(PBA)@Ti3C2Tx nanohybrid-based highly sensitive non-enzymatic electrochemical sensor for the detection of glucose in human sweat
Impact of green carbon dot nanoparticles on seedling emergence, crop growth and seed yield in blackgram (Vigna mungo L. Hepper)
Optimization of TIG welding process parameters using Taguchi technique for the joining of dissimilar metals of AA5083 and AA7075
Direct-bonded diamond membranes for heterogeneous quantum and electronic technologies
item.description: Development of diamond-based quantum and electronic technologies requires heterogeneous integration, which has remained challenging. This work realizes direct bonding of single crystal diamond membranes to a broad range of technology-relevant substrates while maintaining quantum coherence for hosted qubits.

item.title: Stoichiometry modulated tunable optoelectronic properties of Nb-doped WS2 synthesized by chemical vapor deposition method
Eco-friendly synthesis of CuO/Bi2O3 nanocomposite for efficient photocatalytic degradation of rhodamine B dye
Tuneable mesoporous silica material for hydrogen storage application via nano-confined clathrate hydrate construction
item.description: This work focuses on clathrates, ice-like structures incorporating H2 molecules in their cages. In bulk, pure H2 clathrates only form in harsh conditions. Here, the formation of pure H2 clathrate hydrate in confined space of a porous silica is demonstrated at much reduced pressures compared to the bulk H2 clathrate.

item.title: Nonlinear amplification of nano bowl surface concavity on the critical response threshold to biosignals
item.description: Polymer nanoparticles able to detect biological signals in cells at trace concentration level are desirable for practical applications in vivo. Here, the authors report nanobowl nanoparticles with a concave structure with amplified response abilities toward biosignals by the modulation of the surface concavity.

item.title: Influence of flexoelectricity on coupled electromechanical response of 2D MXene/graphene-based hybrid piezocomposites
Ferroelectric tungsten bronze-based ceramics with high-energy storage performance via weakly coupled relaxor design and grain boundary optimization
item.description: The authors enhance energy storage performance in tetragonal tungsten bronze structure ferroelectrics using a multiscale regulation strategy. By adjusting the composition and sintering process of BaSrTiNb2-xTaxO9 ceramics, they introduce grain refinement and perovskite second-phase precipitation.

item.title: Control of a fixed wing unmanned aerial vehicle using a higher-order sliding mode controller and non-linear PID controller
Characterizing smartphone capabilities for seismic and structural monitoring
Non-contact photoacoustic imaging with a silicon photonics-based Laser Doppler Vibrometer
Tuning metal-support interactions in nickel–zeolite catalysts leads to enhanced stability during dry reforming of methane
item.description: Ni-based catalysts are highly reactive for DRM, but they tend to deactivate quickly due to sintering and/or coking. Here a simple method for anchoring dispersed Ni sites in dealuminated Beta zeolite, enhancing metal-support interactions, results in a catalyst with superior stability and performance for DRM.

item.title: Nonlocal photonic quantum gates over 7.0 km
item.description: Full-fledged quantum communication networks would allow distributed quantum computing across multiple remote nodes, but typical implementations are stuck at meters-scale distances. Here the authors demonstrate teleportation-based nonlocal CNOT gates, distributed Deutsch-Jozsa algorithm and quantum phase estimation across 7 km space separation.

item.title: The manufacture, optical properties, and mechanical aspects of europium-doped borate glasses
Eco-friendly synthesis of bioactive silver nanoparticles from black roasted gram (Cicer arietinum) for biomedical applications
Application of operating scenarios and analysis of unstable flow characteristics at various angles of inlet guide vane
A structural rationale for reversible vs irreversible amyloid fibril formation from a single protein
item.description: In this paper, the authors revealed the distinct folding motifs for irreversible and reversible amyloids derived from a single protein, by combining multiple mesoscopic and molecular techniques including AFM, cryo-EM and solid-state NMR.

item.title: Investigating the potential of triclinic ABSe3 (A = Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs; B = Si, Ge, Sn) perovskites as a new class of lead-free photovoltaic materials
Advances in quantum imaging
item.description: This Review provides an overview of the most recently developed quantum imaging systems, highlighting the nonclassical properties of sources, such as bright squeezed light, entangled photons and single-photon emitters that enable their functionality.

item.title: Experimental comparison of the effects of the two designed probes for exfoliation of graphene by sonication
Halogenated-edge polymeric semiconductor for efficient spin transport
item.description: The spin transport mechanism remains unclear for organic semiconductors. Here, authors investigate the effect of halogen substitution in bay-annulated indigo-based polymers and reveal the distance of substitution site from conjugated center and nitrogen atoms play crucial roles in spin relaxation.

item.title: Dynamic mode decomposition based Doppler monitoring of de novo cavitation induced by pulsed HIFU: an in vivo feasibility study
Development of a one-pot synthesis of rGO in water by optimizing Tour’s method parameters
MOF-818 nanoparticles as radical scavengers to improve the aging resistance of silk fabric
Ultrahigh-resolution, high-fidelity quantum dot pixels patterned by dielectric electrophoretic deposition
item.description: The orthogonal electric field-induced template-assisted dielectric electrophoretic deposition is proposed to achieve high pixel resolution (23090 PPI) with a high fidelity (99%), which is further demonstrated for efficient electroluminescent devices.

item.title: Sustainable production of biodiesel from waste cooking oil using magnesium oxide nano catalyst: An optimization study
Simulation of asteroid deflection with a megajoule-class X-ray pulse
item.description: Deflection is one of the options discussed for preventing catastrophic collisions of asteroids with Earth. Now, a megajoule-class X-ray pulse is used to simulate such scenarios, demonstrating that it is a viable strategy at higher interceptor energies.

item.title: Sheared turbulent flows and wake dynamics of an idled floating tidal turbine
item.description: Ocean energy extraction is on the rise, but complex flows still challenge reliable tidal stream energy generation. Here, using aerial drones and boat-based surveys, authors map out the turbulent flows around an idled, utility-scale floating tidal turbine.

item.title: Examination of flow birefringence induced by the shear components along the optical axis using a parallel-plate-type rheometer
Machine learning the electric field response of condensed phase systems using perturbed neural network potentials
item.description: External electric fields are pivotal in modifying chemical reactivity for energy applications. Here the authors introduce a modular approach to include them in machine learning molecular dynamics simulations of condensed phase systems.

item.title: Follicular mediated etodolac phosalosomal gel for contact dermatitis alleviation, insights from optimization to in-vivo appraisal
Understanding the mechanisms behind the antibacterial activity of magnesium hydroxide nanoparticles against sulfate-reducing bacteria in sediments
Anti-Helicobacter pylori activity of nanocomposites from chitosan/broccoli mucilage/selenium nanoparticles
A microspectrometer with dual-signal spectral reconstruction
item.description: A semifloating molybdenum disulfide homojunction exhibits a photoelectric response with a tunable amplitude and relaxation time, which can be used for reconstructive spectroscopy with high resolution and a small device footprint.

item.title: Matrix-induced defects and molecular doping in the afterglow of SiO2 microparticles
item.description: Silica encapsulation can quench nonradiative relaxation and yield afterglow emission in materials. Here, the authors transfer this strategy to molecular emitters by doping them into silica microparticles enhancing both emission intensity and lifetimes.

item.title: Aqueous phase adsorption of phenothiazine derivative onto zinc oxide doped activated carbon
Properties of phosphorus-boron co-doped c-Si quantum dots/SiNx:H thin film prepared by PECVD in-situ deposition
Lattice expansion in ruthenium nanozymes improves catalytic activity and electro-responsiveness for boosting cancer therapy
item.description: Nanozymes are promising for cancer therapy, but it is challenging to enhance the catalytic activity of nanozymes in the tumor microenvironment. Here, the authors report that modulating lattice spacing of ruthenium-based nanozymes improves their catalytic activity and electro-responsiveness to self-powered electric field, optimizing cancer therapeutic outcome.

item.title: Self-propelled directed transport of C60 fullerene on the surface of the cone-shaped carbon nanotubes
​Statistical-based optimization and mechanism assessments of Arsenic (III)​ adsorption by ZnO-Halloysite nanocomposite​
Facile synthesis of novel acidic modified magnetic graphene oxide and its application in the green synthesis of pyrimido[4,5-b]quinolines
Dual parameter smart sensor for nitrogen and temperature sensing based on defect-engineered 1T-MoS2
Fe3O4@gC3N4@Thiamine: a novel heterogeneous catalyst for the synthesis of heterocyclic compounds and microextraction of tebuconazole in food samples
Brillouin laser-driven terahertz oscillator up to 3 THz with femtosecond-level timing jitter
item.description: A Brillouin laser-driven terahertz oscillator is developed. The phase noise level of the generated terahertz waves is less than –100 dBc Hz–1, translating to timing noise below 10 as Hz–1/2 at 10 kHz Fourier frequency, over a carrier frequency range from 300 GHz to 3 THz.

item.title: High-brightness transition metal-sensitized lanthanide near-infrared luminescent nanoparticles
item.description: Cr3+-sensitized lanthanide-doped nanoparticles afford high-brightness luminescence in the near-infrared region for applications in in vivo non-invasive bioimaging.

item.title: Solar light driven enhanced in photocatalytic activity of novel Gd incorporated ZnO/SnO2 heterogeneous nanocomposites
Comparative study on structural, morphological, and optical properties of MS/Fe3O4 nanocomposites and M-doped Fe3O4 nanopowders (M = Mn, Zn)
Analysis of forming mechanism and influencing factors of thermoacoustic plate end temperature difference
Controllable p- and n-type behaviours in emissive perovskite semiconductors
item.description: The charge carrier polarity and concentrations in an emissive perovskite semiconductor can be adjusted by incorporating a molecular dopant widely used for the passivation and structural control of optoelectronic perovskite materials.

item.title: Pollution of the environment and building interiors during asbestos removal as a result of lack of negative pressure in the working areas
Research on denoising method based on temperature and humidity profile lidar
Highly sensitive detection of kojic acid in food samples using fluorescent carbon dots derived from pomegranate peel
Label-free 3D molecular imaging of living tissues using Raman spectral projection tomography
item.description: RSPT enables 3D imaging of tissues with label-free molecular contrast at mesoscale resolution. Here, the authors demonstrate its effectiveness in visualizing complex phantoms and tissue heterogeneities.

item.title: Preparation of silver nanowires with controlled parameters for conductive transparent electrodes
Novel composite of nano zinc oxide and nano propolis as antibiotic for antibiotic-resistant bacteria: a promising approach
Supported Au single atoms and nanoparticles on MoS2 for highly selective CO2-to-CH3COOH photoreduction
item.description: Reducing CO2 to CH3COOH using visible and near-infrared light is challenging. Here, Wu and Zhang et al. incorporate Au nanoparticles and single atoms into Mo-edge-rich MoS2 to provide a pathway to overcome limitations and boost productivity.

item.title: MXene-based kirigami designs: showcasing reconfigurable frequency selectivity in microwave regime
item.description: Modern communication applications may demand devices with tunable performances and simple fabrications. Here, we show strain dependent, adjustable RF/microwave performance by applying patterns of conductive Ti3C2Tx MXene coatings on low-cost acetate substrates in a straightforward coating process.

item.title: Synthesis and characterization of bentonite-based NiO nanoparticles as bi-functional heterogeneous catalyst for efficient synthesis of 1,8-dioxo-decahydroacridines
Experimental investigation of zinc ferrite/insulation oil nanofluid natural convection heat transfer, AC dielectric breakdown voltage, and thermophysical properties
Thermohydrodynamic analysis of magnetorheological conical bearings with conjugated heat transfer
A two-stage defect detection method for unevenly illuminated self-adhesive printed materials
CTAB-crafted ZnO nanostructures for environmental remediation and pathogen control
Optimising 4D imaging of fast-oscillating structures using X-ray microtomography with retrospective gating
A bioinspired tactile scanner for computer haptics
item.description: Computer haptics addresses tactile sensation and haptic rendering particularly for the Metaverse. Here, the authors report a design and implantation of a tactile scanner, to collect data used to render haptic feedback and recreate a feeling of touch.

item.title: Improvement of photocatalytic ammonia production of cobalt ferrite nanoparticles utilizing microporous ZSM-5 type ferrisilicate zeolite
Anticancer efficacy of magnetite nanoparticles synthesized using aqueous extract of brown seaweed Rosenvingea intricata, South Andaman, India
Bragg grating etalon-based optical fiber for ultrasound and optoacoustic detection
item.description: The authors embed a micro-resonator in a 10 µm core fiber, which enables ultrasound wave detection with large bandwidth and small aperture. This facilitates high-resolution optoacoustic (photoacoustic) imaging and ultrasonography.

item.title: Preparation of magnetite nanoparticles and their application in the removal of methylene blue dye from wastewater
Green synthesis of magnesium oxide nanoparticles using Hyphaene thebaica extract and their photocatalytic activities
Harnessing forward multiple scattering for optical imaging deep inside an opaque medium
item.description: Microscopy exploits light scattering to image biological tissues, but heterogeneities distort wave trajectories, creating a foggy image. A digital approach is proposed to harness these complex paths and reveal the inner structure of opaque media.

item.title: Nanofluidic sensing inspired by the anomalous water dynamics in electrical angstrom-scale channels
item.description: Nanoconfined water has unique properties, often leading to the discovery of unexpected phenomena, which play key roles in applications such as sensing, filtration, and catalysis. Here authors report electrically controlled gating in cation (K+/Li+) intercalated multilayer Ti3C2 and describe anomalous water dynamics in electrical angstrom-scale channels.

item.title: Green synthesis of trimetallic CuO/Ag/ZnO nanocomposite using Ziziphus spina-christi plant extract: characterization, statistically experimental designs, and antimicrobial assessment
Femtosecond laser writing of ant-inspired reconfigurable microbot collectives
item.description: Microbot collectives can cooperate to accomplish complex tasks that are difficult for a single individual. Here, the authors report magnetic and light-driven ant microbot collectives that are capable of reconfiguring multiple assembled architectures.

item.title: Anticancer, antimicrobial and antioxidant activity of CuO–ZnO bimetallic nanoparticles: green synthesised from Eryngium foetidum leaf extract
Combination chemotherapy via poloxamer 188 surface-modified PLGA nanoparticles that traverse the blood–brain–barrier in a glioblastoma model
Advanced seismic resilient performance of steel MRF equipped with viscoelastic friction dampers
Experimental research on the horizontally getting together behaviors of acoustically manipulated bi-particle
A physical derivation of high-flux ion transport in biological channel via quantum ion coherence
item.description: Authors demonstrate coherence of the K+ ions confined in potassium-selective channels, which determines transport. The coherent oscillation state of confined K+ ions in the channel dominates each transport event, serving as the physical basis for the high flux of channel.

item.title: Responsive circularly polarized ultralong room temperature phosphorescence materials with easy-to-scale and chiral-sensing performance
item.description: Circularly polarised room temperature materials have promising applications, but colour control is still challenging. Here, the authors report the development of these materials with full colour based on anionic cellulose derivatives and achiral luminophores.

item.title: Nutrient strengthening and lead alleviation in Brassica Napus L. by foliar ZnO and TiO2-NPs modulating antioxidant system, improving photosynthetic efficiency and reducing lead uptake
Electrically activated ferroelectric nematic microrobots
item.description: Ferroelectric nematic liquids with apparently high dielectric constant exhibit remarkable electric field induced phenomena. The authors report creating small fluid ferroelectric units that function as active particles under an electric field.

item.title: Polarized Raman mapping and phase-transition by CW excitation for fast purely optical characterization of VO2 thin films
Fluorescent, multifunctional anti-counterfeiting, fast response electrophoretic display based on TiO2/CsPbBr3 composite particles
item.description: We fabricated a multifunctional anti-counterfeiting (AC) device based on fluorescent electrophoretic particles, which can achieve dynamic AC display by switching the electric field and UV light.

item.title: Performance evaluation of a hyphenated laser spectroscopy system with conventional methods for microplastic analysis
Electrospun nanofibrous wound dressings with enhanced efficiency through carbon quantum dots and citrate incorporation
How local electric field regulates C–C coupling at a single nanocavity in electrocatalytic CO2 reduction
item.description: Precisely tunning the C–C coupling pathway through local microenvironments remains somewhat unclear. Here, the authors developed a nano-confined Raman spectroscopic strategy to uncover how the local electric field regulates the evolution of C–C coupling intermediates at a specific nanocavity.

item.title: Harmonic errors of a 9.4 T all-REBCO NMR magnet affected by screening current and geometric inconsistency of coated conductors
Deep-blue organic light-emitting diodes for ultrahigh-definition displays
item.description: Highly twisted multi-boron-based multiple-resonance thermally activated delayed fluorescence emitters enable deep-blue organic light-emitting diodes with high colour purity, a narrow full-width at half-maximum of 14 nm and a peak external quantum efficiency of 39.2%.

item.title: Comprehensive insights into phosphorus solubility and organic matter’s impact on black phosphate leaching
Temperature stability and enhanced transport properties by surface modifications of silica nanoparticle tracers for geo-reservoir exploration
An interpretable capacity prediction method for lithium-ion battery considering environmental interference
Qualitative and quantitative electrochemiluminescence evaluation of trace Pt single-atom in MXenes
item.description: Here, an electrochemiluminescence (ECL) platform is developed to analyze trace Pt single-atoms in MXenes, where distinct reactive oxygen species originating from different Pt species react with luminol, allowing for monitoring of Pt environment.

item.title: Graphene-based nanocomposites as gamma- and X-ray radiation shield
Organic polaritonic light-emitting diodes with high luminance and color purity toward laser displays
Artificial organic afferent nerves enable closed-loop tactile feedback for intelligent robot
item.description: Intelligent artificial tactile system for neurorobotics remains challenging. Here, Chen et al. developed an artificial organic afferent nerve to implement slip recognition and prevention actions by learning the real-time spatial information of directional touch.

item.title: C-reactive protein (CRP) evaluation in human urine using optical sensor supported by machine learning
Selective excitation of vibrations in a single molecule
item.description: The authors demonstrate selective excitation of atomic vibrations in a single molecule utilizing tip-enhanced resonance Raman spectroscopy, by precisely tuning the wavelength of the exciting laser to be resonant with the molecular vibronic transitions.

item.title: Synthesis of superparamagnetic Fe3O4–graphene oxide-based material for the photodegradation of clonazepam
Towards clinical application of freehand optical ultrasound imaging
Synthesis, characterization of chitosan/tripolyphosphate nanoparticles loaded with 4-chloro-2-methylphenoxyacetate sodium salt and its herbicidal activity against Bidens pilosa L.
Effect of liquid level monitor gas injection point size on information source amplitude-frequency characteristics
Embedded periodically ABHs and distributed DVAs for passive low-frequency broadband vibration attenuation in thin-walled structures
Cavity-enhanced energy transport in molecular systems
item.description: The authors discuss the physics underlying the enhancement of energy transfer and energy transport in molecular systems and identify key questions and theoretical challenges for future research.

item.title: Deep learning tight-binding approach for large-scale electronic simulations at finite temperatures with ab initio accuracy
item.description: Electronic simulations of large systems are computationally demanding. Here, authors develop DeePTB, a deep learning approach for efficient tight-binding calculations with ab initio accuracy, enabling million-atom simulations at finite temperatures.

item.title: Theory and application of robust linear phase-shift algorithm for phase-shift deflectometry method
Numerical simulation and experimental investigation of coating influence on extrusion tap wear
A conditional latent autoregressive recurrent model for generation and forecasting of beam dynamics in particle accelerators
DEM parameters of slope cultivated purple soil in Southwest China and interaction mechanism between very narrow tine
Fractional-order state space reconstruction: a new frontier in multivariate complex time series
Spontaneous piezoeletric effect as evidence of ferroelastoelectricity in guanidine zinc sulfate crystal
Impact of Bi2O3 on prepared nano (SiO2-Na2O-CaO-B2O3) glass as radiation shielding material
Thermal management towards ultra-bright and stable perovskite nanocrystal-based pure red light-emitting diodes
item.description: For achieving ultra-bright and stable pure red perovskite nanocrystal-based LEDs, the authors report a synergistic strategy by reducing Joule heating generation via surface ligand anchoring effect and improving thermal dissipation via using sapphire substrates and implementing pulse-driving mode.

item.title: Compact inertial sensors for measuring external disturbances of physics experiments
Upconversion-based chiral nanoprobe for highly selective dual-mode sensing and bioimaging of hydrogen sulfide in vitro and in vivo
item.description: The schematic of the preparation process of chiral UCNPs/CuxOS@ZIF nanoprobe, in vitro highly selective UCL/CD dual-mode sensing for hydrogen sulfide, and in vivo bioimaging.

item.title: Tracking the extensive three-dimensional motion of single ions by an engineered point-spread function
item.description: Spatial motion tracking of single atoms is of great importance for investigating the dynamics in atomic systems. Here, the authors extend the static imaging method to 3D dynamic detection by exploiting an engineered point spread function and demonstrate it by tracking the motion of single ions.

item.title: Passive wing deployment and retraction in beetles and flapping microrobots
item.description: We find that rhinoceros beetles passively deploy and retract their hindwings without muscular activity, demonstrating this with insect-like microrobots.

item.title: Comprehensive study for radiation shielding features for Bi2O3–B2O3–ZnO composite using computational radioanalytical Phy-X/PSD, MCNP5, and SRIM software
Prediction of potential high-temperature superconductivity in ternary Y–Hf–H compounds under high pressure
Atom interferometry at arbitrary orientations and rotation rates
item.description: Cold atoms inertial sensors offer great precision and sensitivity, yet their use in mobile applications has been hindered by the effects of rotations on their measurements. Here, authors demonstrate an atom interferometer operating over a wide range of orientations and rotation rates, thanks to hybridisation with accelerometers and gyroscopes.

item.title: Symmetry-breaking dynamics of a photoionized carbon dioxide dimer
item.description: In a time-resolved Coulomb explosion imaging study using ultrafast extreme ultraviolet pulses, combined with theoretical simulations, authors reveal unexpected asymmetric rearrangement of carbon dioxide dimer ion, including a CO3 moiety formation.

item.title: The effect of including dynamic imaging derived airway wall motion in CFD simulations of respiratory airflow in patients with OSA
Vertically stacked skin-like active-matrix display with ultrahigh aperture ratio
item.description: This study proposes the “discrete preparation-multilayer lamination” strategy, which effectively addresses the challenges associated with vertically stacked skin-like AMOLEDs and demonstrates their potential for next-generation wearable displays.

item.title: Revealing detrimental effects of various DC electrical energy conditions on different multidrug resistant bacteria: a comprehensive study
Nanoscale spin rectifiers for harvesting ambient radiofrequency energy
item.description: Sensitive spin rectifier devices can be used to create rectennas that harvest ambient radiofrequency signals between –62 and –20 dBm, and can be used to create on-chip co-planar-waveguide-based spin rectifier arrays with large zero-bias sensitivity and high efficiency.

item.title: Uncovering the phonon spectra and lattice dynamics of plastically deformable InSe van der Waals crystals
item.description: Recent studies have reported the exceptional plasticity of InSe van der Waals crystals, but their deformation-correlated lattice dynamics remains unexplored. Here, the authors investigate the correlations of plastic interlayer slip, lattice anharmonicity and thermal transport in β-InSe crystals via neutron scattering techniques.

item.title: Investigation of piezoelectric printing devices for oil-free and on-demand picolitre monodisperse droplet generation
Numerical study of cavitation shock wave emission in the thin liquid layer by power ultrasonic vibratory machining
Identification of force chains in wet coal dust layer and the effect of porosity on three-body contact stiffness
Highly efficient pure-blue organic light-emitting diodes based on rationally designed heterocyclic phenophosphazinine-containing emitters
item.description: The inefficient spin-flip process of multi-resonance emitters could compromise the device performance of light-emitting diodes. Here, the authors incorporate conformationally flexible donor to enhance the density of excited states, achieving 20-fold increase in reverse intersystem crossing rate.

item.title: Exploring the collision, acoustic and thermal energy dissipation distribution of discrete mass
Preparation and characterization of conjugated PVA/PANi blend films doped with functionalized graphene for thermoelectric applications
Determining intrinsic sensitivity and the role of multiple scattering in speckle metrology
item.description: Speckle can be harnessed for a wide variety of metrology applications. This Expert Recommendation proposes a standardized metric to allow comparisons of the intrinsic sensitivity of different approaches, and it clarifies when multiple scattering can be beneficial in increasing sensitivity of measurements.

item.title: Surface-energy ratchet motor with geometrical symmetry driven by biased random walk
Boosting piezoelectric properties of PVDF nanofibers via embedded graphene oxide nanosheets
Anomalous flocking in nonpolar granular Brownian vibrators
item.description: An experimental method is needed to measure the effective interparticle attraction resulting from inelastic collisions for a quantitative study of non-equilibrium systems. In this study, the authors report the large-scale collective motion of non-polar particles and identify the phase transition point between the granular fluid phase and the collective fluid phase.

item.title: Pulse-doubling perovskite nanowire lasers enabled by phonon-assisted multistep energy funneling
item.description: Perovskite multiple quantum wells are promising gain mediums for laser pulse multiplication. Here, the authors demonstrate a perovskite double-pulsed nanowire laser with pulse interval of 22 ps.

item.title: Efficient eco-friendly synthesis of carbon nanotubes over graphite nanosheets from yellow corn: a one-step green approach
Robust structural superlubricity under gigapascal pressures
item.description: An unexpectedly strong pressure-resistance and wear-free feature of structural superlubricity is reported. The breakdown pressure beyond which wear is triggered can exceed material strengths, and is determined by structural and electronic effects.

item.title: Structural, elastic, electronic, optical and anisotropy properties of newly quaternary Tl2HgGeSe4 via DFPT predictions associated to XPES and RS experiments
Effects of negative ions on equilibrium solar plasmas in the fabric of gravito-electrostatic sheath model
Non-destructive diagnosis of Inflammatory Bowel Disease by near-infrared spectroscopy and aquaphotomics
Jahn-Teller effect and features of divalent copper ion behavior in multicomponent borate crystals
Nonlinear similarity characterisation and validation of dynamic response of ship stiffened plate structure under explosion load impacts
Acquisition of molecular rolling lubrication by self-curling of graphite nanosheet at cryogenic temperature
item.description: Molecular rolling lubrication can control friction phenomenon like a wheel. Here, the authors find the self-curled deformation effect of graphite nanosheets at cryogenic temperature, which promotes the in-situ formation of parallel nano-rollers, and acquire molecular rolling lubrication.

item.title: Ultrasound sensing with optical microcavities
Effects of nonlinearity on Anderson localization of surface gravity waves
item.description: Anderson localization is a linear phenomenon, with ongoing debate about the impact of nonlinearity. This study shows that nonlinearity strengthens the localization of surface-gravity waves in a canal with a random bottom through experimental measurements and numerical simulations.

item.title: Refining silicon nitride waveguide quality through femtosecond laser annealing
Anneal-free ultra-low loss silicon nitride integrated photonics
item.description: We demonstrate for the first time, a uniform low temperature (<250 °C) process for fabricating both high-confinement thick and low-confinement thin ultra-low loss Silicon nitride waveguides.

item.title: Enhancing hydrodynamic forces through miniaturized control of square cylinders using the lattice Boltzmann method
Lattice excitations in NdFeO3 through polarized optical spectroscopies
Ultrasonic liquid crystal tunable light diffuser
Electron holography observation of individual ferrimagnetic lattice planes
item.description: The magnetic fields of an individual lattice plane inside materials with a non-uniform structure were observed under magnetic-field-free conditions by electron holography.

item.title: Observation of the scaling dimension of fractional quantum Hall anyons
item.description: The scaling dimension of fractional quantum Hall anyons shows agreement with expectations following examination of thermal-to-shot-noise crossover measurements by fitting to the predicted finite-temperature expression involving both the scaling dimension of quasiparticles and their charge.

item.title: Experimental demonstration of tunable hybrid improper ferroelectricity in double-perovskite superlattice films
item.description: Authors realize a tunable hybrid improper ferroelectricity in [La2NiMnO6/La2CoMnO6]n double perovskite superlattices at room temperature by a strain-driven oxygen octahedral distortion strategy.

item.title: Brillouin expanded time-domain analysis based on dual optical frequency combs
item.description: BETDA, using dual optical frequency combs, reduces pump-probe beating to low-frequency bands in an expanded time domain, unlike ordinary BOTDA which operates at high RF frequency bands.

item.title: Study on the Infrared and Raman spectra of Ti3AlB2, Zr3AlB2, Hf3AlB2, and Ta3AlB2 by first-principles calculations
Quantitative phase imaging based on holography: trends and new perspectives
Measuring gravitational attraction with a lattice atom interferometer
item.description: Using an optical lattice to suspend atoms, the gravitational attraction of a miniature source mass can be determined by an atom interferometer with much greater accuracy compared with atoms in free fall.

item.title: Improving structural and magnetic properties of zinc stannate thin films through nickel doping via sol–gel method
Data-fusion for in-situ monitoring and molten state identification during LPBF of NiCoCr medium-entropy alloy
Raman micro-spectroscopy reveals the spatial distribution of fumarate in cells and tissues
item.description: Methods for the analysis of metabolites in cells often require sample disruption and lack spatio-temporal resolution. Here, the authors show that Raman spectroscopy can directly detect fumarate in living cells and animal tissues ex vivo.

item.title: Millimetre-deep micrometre-resolution vibrational imaging by shortwave infrared photothermal microscopy
item.description: Shortwave infrared photothermal microscopy enables chemical imaging at millimetre depths with a micrometre spatial resolution in tissue-mimicking phantoms, intact tumour spheroids and various biological tissues.

item.title: Quantum squeezing in a nonlinear mechanical oscillator
item.description: Mechanical modes promise applications in continuous-variable quantum information processing, but only if the final two elements—squeezing and nonlinearity—are achieved. Experiments with an oscillator coupled to a transmon qubit now achieve this.

item.title: 3D microscopic reconstruction of pearls using combined optical microscopy and photogrammetry
The mechanism for directional hearing in fish
item.description: A study demonstrates that the fish Danionella cerebrum is able to discriminate the direction of sound by comparing the relative phase of pressure and particle motion.

item.title: High-entropy relaxor ferroelectric ceramics for ultrahigh energy storage
item.description: The authors present an equimolar-ratio element high-entropy strategy for designing high-performance dielectric ceramics and uncover the immense potential of tetragonal tungsten bronze-type materials for advanced energy storage applications.

item.title: Bulk-suppressed and surface-sensitive Raman scattering by transferable plasmonic membranes with irregular slot-shaped nanopores
item.description: Characterizing surfaces by Raman spectroscopy is limited by the competition of surface and bulk Raman responses. Here the authors use nanoporous plasmonic membranes to enhance surface Raman signals while suppressing bulk contributions.

item.title: Rapid photocatalytic dye degradation, enhanced antibacterial and antifungal activities of silver stacked zinc oxide garnished on carbon nanotubes
Microsecond-response perovskite light-emitting diodes for active-matrix displays
item.description: An individual-particle passivation strategy that reduces ion migration in perovskite nanocrystal film can be used to make high-refresh-rate active-matrix displays with microsecond response times reduced by three orders of magnitude compared with typical perovskite light-emitting diodes.

item.title: Numerical simulation and experimental verification of the velocity field in asymmetric circular bends
Probing the design principles of photosynthetic systems through fluorescence noise measurement
Fabrication of red-emitting perovskite LEDs by stabilizing their octahedral structure
item.description: Red-emitting perovskite LEDs were fabricated by stabilizing their octahedral structure with a ligand to yield devices with enhanced efficiency, spectral stability and lifetime.

item.title: Coherence limits in lattice atom interferometry at the one-minute scale
item.description: Applications of atom interferometry require sufficiently long coherence times. Now, confining atoms in an optical lattice shows that the decoherence rate slows down markedly at hold times that exceed tens of seconds.

item.title: Dispersive Fourier transform based dual-comb ranging
item.description: Here the authors develop a dispersive Fourier transform (DFT) based LIDAR method utilizing phase-locked Vernier dual soliton laser combs and demonstrate improved precision in the measurements.

item.title: Preparation of a self-matting, anti-fingerprint and skin-tactile wood coating via biomimetic self-wrinkling patterns
Brillouin gain microscopy
item.description: By measuring the Brillouin gain only at mechanical frequencies of interest, Brillouin gain microscopy enables Brillouin imaging with a temporal resolution of 100 µs with excitation energies of 23 µJ on biological samples.

item.title: Intrinsically stretchable organic photovoltaics by redistributing strain to PEDOT:PSS with enhanced stretchability and interfacial adhesion
item.description: The realization of intrinsically stretchable organic photovoltaics with excellent mechanical robustness remains challenging. Here, the authors redistribute the strain in the active layer to PEDOT:PSS electrodes with simultaneously enhanced stretchability and interfacial adhesion in the device.

item.title: Investigation of physical and electrical properties of a suboxide layer at Si/Si-hexafluoride interface
Harnessing Raman spectroscopy for the analysis of plant diversity
Tuning the band gap, optical, mechanical, and electrical features of a bio-blend by Cr2O3/V2O5 nanofillers for optoelectronics and energy applications
A vision chip with complementary pathways for open-world sensing
item.description: Inspired by the human visual system, a vision chip with primitive-based complementary pathways is developed to overcome the power and bandwidth wall of vision systems, achieving fast, precise, robust and high-dynamic-range sensing efficiently in the open world.

item.title: Ultra-high spatio-temporal resolution imaging with parallel acquisition-readout structured illumination microscopy (PAR-SIM)
item.description: Higher-speed super-resolution microscopy drives breakthroughs in dynamic life sciences—Parallel acquisition-readout structured illumination microscopy (PAR-SIM).

item.title: Narrowband room temperature phosphorescence of closed-loop molecules through the multiple resonance effect
item.description: Luminescent materials with narrowband emissions are vital for optoelectronic applications. Here, the authors achieve room temperature phosphorescence with a FWHM of 30 nm through the multiple resonance effect and showcase its practical application in X-ray imaging.

item.title: Microsphere-assisted hyperspectral imaging: super-resolution, non-destructive metrology for semiconductor devices
Thermal decomposition study of 4-methyloxybenzyl-glycoside by TG/DTA and on-line pyrolysis-photoionization mass spectrometry
Unveiling excitons in two-dimensional \(\beta\)-pnictogens
Preparation and characterization of hybrid polypyrrole nanoparticles as a conducting polymer with controllable size
Enhancing crystal integrity and structural rigidity of CsPbBr3 nanoplatelets to achieve a narrow color-saturated blue emission
item.description: The chemical equilibrium is optimized using N-dodecylbenzene sulfonic acid for enhancing the crystal integrity and structural rigidity of CsPbBr3 perovskite nanoplatelets, resulting in their spectrally stable, bright and extremely narrow color-saturated blue emission.

item.title: Detection of surface enhanced Raman scattering active hotspot using near field scanning optical microscopy
Lithium tantalate photonic integrated circuits for volume manufacturing
item.description: Electro-optical photonic integrated circuits based on lithium tantalate perform as well as current state-of-the-art ones using lithium niobate but the material has the advantage of existing commercial uses in consumer electronics, easing the problem of scalability.

item.title: Decoupling excitons from high-frequency vibrations in organic molecules
item.description: A molecular design strategy for reducing the vibration-induced non-radiative losses in emissive organic semiconductors is realized by decoupling excitons from high-frequency vibrations.

item.title: Non-invasive prediction of maca powder adulteration using a pocket-sized spectrophotometer and machine learning techniques
Pure-high-even-order dispersion bound solitons complexes in ultra-fast fiber lasers
item.description: The pure-high-even-order dispersion bound solitons complexes, which build up in high-order dispersion management ultra-fast fiber laser, are revealed both theoretically and experimentally, enriching the framework towards multi-soliton complexes.

item.title: Delayed room temperature phosphorescence enabled by phosphines
item.description: Room-temperature phosphorescence usually occurs immediately after the removal of excitation. Here the authors achieve combined instant and delayed phosphorescence through introduction of phosphines into carbazole emitters.

item.title: Ultra-highly sensitive dual gases detection based on photoacoustic spectroscopy by exploiting a long-wave, high-power, wide-tunable, single-longitudinal-mode solid-state laser
A new gas detection technique through cross-correlation with a complex aperiodic FBG
High space–time bandwidth product imaging in low coherence quantitative phase microscopy
A novel method to eliminate the symmetry dependence of fiber coils for shupe mitigation
High-throughput quantum photonic devices emitting indistinguishable photons in the telecom C-band
item.description: An efficient way of realising a large number of telecom single-photon emitters for quantum communication is still missing. Here, the authors use a wide-field imaging technique for fast localization of single InAs/InP quantum dots, which are then integrated into circular Bragg grating cavities featuring high single-photon purity and indistinguishability.

item.title: A new Mach–Zehnder interference temperature measuring sensor based on silica-based chip
A comprehensive investigation of Bi2O3 on the physical, structural, optical, and electrical properties of K2O.ZnO.V2O5.B2O3 glasses
Acoustic stimulation of the human round window by laser-induced nonlinear optoacoustics
Onion-like multicolor thermally activated delayed fluorescent carbon quantum dots for efficient electroluminescent light-emitting diodes
item.description: Shi et al. report the synthesis of multicolour thermally activated delayed fluorescent carbon dots with 3D onion-like configuration to stabilise the triplet state and reduce the singlet-triplet energy gap. LEDs with EQE of 6.0–9.9% are achieved, a step further for efficient and stable displays.

item.title: An all-optical multidirectional mechano-sensor inspired by biologically mechano-sensitive hair sensilla
item.description: Hair-like sensilla are evolved widely in organisms that perceive mechanical signals. Here, the authors report an all-optical mechano-sensor that can detect the real-time, directional displacement and force at several nm and μN levels.

item.title: Spectral band selection and ANIMR-GAN for high-performance multispectral coal gangue classification
Multimodal fiber probe for simultaneous mid-infrared and Raman spectroscopy
Quartz-enhanced multiheterodyne resonant photoacoustic spectroscopy
item.description: We introduce an innovative quartz-enhanced multiheterodyne resonant photoacoustic spectroscopy technique that utilizes a quartz tuning fork to achieve resonant detection of a dual comb based on the photoacoustic effect.

item.title: Ultrasound-induced reorientation for multi-angle optical coherence tomography
item.description: Accessing multi-angle views of organoids is important for biology and oncology. The authors propose ultrasound-induced reorientation for multi-angle optical coherence tomography, using a 3D-printed acoustic trap to levitate and rotate samples with a model-based algorithm for reconstruction.

item.title: Photooxidation triggered ultralong afterglow in carbon nanodots
item.description: Biocompatible afterglow materials have potential in imaging applications, but are challenging to prepare. Here the authors report the development of carbon nanodots with near-infrared afterglow, and demonstrate their use in imaging for tumour resection.

item.title: Extreme focusing of hard X-ray free-electron laser pulses enables 7 nm focus width and 1022 W cm−2 intensity
item.description: Researchers focused hard X-rays from a free-electron laser down to transverse dimensions of ~7 nm × 7 nm, enabling a two-order increase in intensity of photons and yielding access to the elusive 1022 W cm−2 regime. Such intense, short-wavelength electromagnetic radiation may probe atomic, molecular and optical physics with extremely high resolution.

item.title: Ultra-high-Q free-space coupling to microtoroid resonators
item.description: We demonstrate free-space coupling to microtoroids using one objective to excite and collect scattered resonant light. We achieve Q-factors > 108 and perform sensing with an SNR > 26 dB.

item.title: Transient stimulated Raman scattering spectroscopy and imaging
item.description: A time-domain excitation strategy for stimulated Raman scattering was achieved by manipulating vibrational wave packet interference. The new method enables simultaneous sub-mM level sensitivity and natural-linewidth-limit Raman spectra.

item.title: Silver molybdate: an excellent optical limiting material under nanoregime for photonic device application
Integrated optical frequency division for microwave and mmWave generation
item.description: A miniaturized optical frequency division system that could transfer the generation of microwaves, with superior spectral purity, to a complementary metal-oxide-semiconductor-compatible integrated photonic platform is demonstrated showing potential for large-volume, low-cost manufacturing for many applications.

item.title: High-performance terahertz modulators induced by substrate field in Te-based all-2D heterojunctions
item.description: We have introduced Te-based all-2D heterojunctions as optically controlled terahertz modulators to significantly promote the device performances and elaborated their charge dynamics driven by substrate effect through first-principles calculations.

item.title: The effects of delayed annealing on the luminescent activity of heavy metal cadmium zinc phosphate glasses activated by: Er3+ and Tb3+ ions
Probing molecules in gas cells of subwavelength thickness with high frequency resolution
item.description: Using gas cells for spectroscopic studies opens possibility for miniaturized platforms that can be integrated with other optical components. Here the authors demonstrate molecular rovibrational spectroscopy by confining molecules in a cell of subwavelength thickness.

item.title: Synergistic chemo-photothermal therapy using gold nanorods supported on thiol-functionalized mesoporous silica for lung cancer treatment
A 3D nanoscale optical disk memory with petabit capacity
item.description: Optical nanoscale disk memory with petabit-level capacity is developed by extending the recording architecture to three dimensions with hundreds of layers, and exabit-level storage can be achieved by stacking the disks into arrays.

item.title: RSPSSL: A novel high-fidelity Raman spectral preprocessing scheme to enhance biomedical applications and chemical resolution visualization
item.description: A novel generic high-fidelity Raman spectral denoising and baseline correction strategy to enhance diverse cross-device/specimen biomedical applications and hyperspectral image chemical resolution visualization to reveal spatial features of cancer tissue.

item.title: Self-supervised dynamic learning for long-term high-fidelity image transmission through unstabilized diffusive media
item.description: This work introduces a cutting-edge technique to overcome dynamic scattering challenges in long-distance multimode fiber transmission, achieving >99.9% accuracy for 1024 modes over 1 km, hence promises applications in diverse scattering scenarios.

item.title: In vivo ultrasound-induced luminescence molecular imaging
item.description: Ultrasound-induced luminescence enables in vivo molecular imaging of tumours and lymph nodes with spatial resolution of 1.46 mm.

item.title: Biaxial strain tuned upconversion photoluminescence of monolayer WS2
Synthesis, structural, optical, and thermal properties of LaFeO3/Poly(methyl methacrylate)/Poly(vinyl acetate) nanocomposites for radiation shielding
Real-time study of spatio-temporal dynamics (4D) of physiological activities in alive biological specimens with different FOVs and resolutions simultaneously
Decomposition of the anisotropic strain in 3D-structure GaN layers using Raman spectroscopy
Non-contact assessment of cardiac physiology using FO-MVSS-based ballistocardiography: a promising approach for heart failure evaluation
Security issues of the gold industry chain based on smart blockchain in the context of the Internet of Things
Observation of transition from superfluorescence to polariton condensation in CsPbBr3 quantum dots film
item.description: We not only confirmed the superfluorescence effect, but also demonstrated the phase transition to cooperative exciton-polariton condensation. This was achieved by applying a regulatory dimension of light field.

item.title: A dual-selective thermal emitter with enhanced subambient radiative cooling performance
item.description: Radiative cooling is a sustainable subambient cooling technology. Here, authors show a scalable and practical design of a dual-selective thermal emitter that is shown to have enhanced radiative cooling potential over existing typical designs.

item.title: Efficient blue electroluminescence from reduced-dimensional perovskites
